panels.content: Data for $host with $interval resolution

panels.description:
**Inactive** - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes

**Active** - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary
panels.title: Total Pages Size

panels.description:
**Inactive** Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)

**Active**  Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs
panels.title: Anonymous Memory Size

panels.description:
**Inactive**  File-backed memory on inactive LRU list

**Active** File-backed memory on active LRU list
panels.title: File Cache Memory Size

panels.description:
**PageTables**  Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses

**AnonPages** Non-file backed pages mapped into userspace page tables

**SwapCache**  Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified

**Slab**  Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)

**Swap**  Swap space used

**Harware Corrupted** Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

**Mapped** Files which have been mmaped, such as libraries

**Dirty** Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk

**Writeback** Memory which is actively being written back to the disk

**WritebackTmp** Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers

**Shmem** Total memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs
panels.title: Memory Usage Types

panels.description:
**Total** total size of vmalloc memory area

**Used** amount of vmalloc area which is used

**Chunk** largest contiguous block of vmalloc area which is free
panels.title: Vmalloc

panels.description:
**Total** Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs

**HugePages** Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated with huge pages

**PmdMapped**  Shared memory mapped into userspace with huge pages
panels.title: Shared Memory

panels.description:
**Committed_AS**  Amount of memory presently allocated on the system

**CommitLimit**  Amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system
panels.title: Committed Memory

panels.description:
**AnonPages** Non-file backed pages mapped into userspace page tables

**AnonHugePages** Non-file backed huge pages mapped into userspace page tables
panels.title: Non-file Backed Pages Size

panels.description:
**Slab** in-kernel data structures cache
**SReclaimable** Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches
 **SUnreclaim** Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure
panels.title: Kernel Cache

panels.description: **Bounce** Memory used for block device "bounce buffers"
panels.title: Bounce Memory

panels.description: **NFS_Unstable** NFS pages sent to the server, but not yet committed to stable storage
panels.title: NFS Pages Size

panels.description:
**Unevictable** Amount of unevictable memory that can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons

**MLocked** Size of pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call
panels.title: Unevictable/MLocked Memory

panels.description:
**HugePages** Total size of the pool of huge pages

**Hugepagesize**  Huge Page size
panels.title: Huge Pages Size

panels.description:
**Total** Number of hugepages being allocated by the kernel (Defined with vm.nr_hugepages)

**Free** The number of hugepages not being allocated by a process

**Surp**  The number of hugepages in the pool above the value in vm.nr_hugepages. The maximum number of surplus hugepages is controlled by vm.nr_overcommit_hugepages.

**Rsvd**  The number of  huge pages for which a commitment to allocate from the pool has been made, but no allocation has yet been made
panels.title: HugePages Statistic
